result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan L Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathan L Ward is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathan L Ward was found guilty of Attempt Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge. Pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of ES; non-payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at $0.

superMiscConds.notes: COURT FINDS DEFENDANT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR EXPUNGEMENT

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment unless in school. If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Changed sentencing judge
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Jonathan L Ward in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jonathan L Ward in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 27 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 12 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 151  days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Court finds defendant is not eligible for expungement

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no loner use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Files, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Jonathan L Ward in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jonathan L Ward in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 21.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 10/14/2015 is vacated.
Pursuant to negotiations, Counts 2 and & 3 are dismissed.  As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Jonathan L Ward not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Br. 21 involved in a Court Trial.  Matter transferred to Br. 22 for Plea Hearing.  All parties notified via email.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Jonathan L Ward not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.   Parties request another Final Pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Specific Discovery received and filed.

Defendant Jonathan L Ward in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jonathan L Ward in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  New offer just received.  Defense needs additional time to discuss the new offer to the defendant.  Defense just requested the DNA results.  State to process this request.  Defendant wants new counsel.  Colloquy conducted between the Court and Defendant regarding his request for new counsel.  Defendant informs the Court that he wants new counsel because of incorrect charge entry on CCAP.   Defendant's request for new counsel denied.  Amended charges will be added that came through defendant's initial appearance.  Matter to remain on for trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Per substitution of judge request against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.
against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by Atty. Edgar Lin on behalf of the defendant.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Jonathan L Ward not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes for Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense plans to file a motion for reconsideration of Judge Stark's decision that denied defense's motion to dismiss.
State objects.
Arguments heard.
Court will address this matter at the Final Pretrial Conference.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Defense filed a substitution of judge today.
The newly assigned judge is Judge Brash.
 
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 09-08-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 10-14-2015 at 9:00 AM - Br. 21, Judge Brash's Court.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Jonathan L Ward not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.

Case adjourned to 06-25-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.
Original Transcript (15 pages) commencing 05/26/2015 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.

Cash bail to remain at $10,000.00 and conditions to include:
  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Intensive Supervision and Electronic Monitoring. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor. Defendant may not live or may not be in any automobile where a firearm is kept.  Defendant may not leave home unless for verfied appointment with attorney at attorney's office. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Jonathan L Ward in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jonathan L Ward in custody.  Antio Apollo on behalf of Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
BRANCH 17 FOR BRANCH 2
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense moves to dismiss count 2 and 3 for lack of probable cause. Arguments heard. Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant pled not guilty at to all 3 counts.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan L Ward in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Jonathan L Ward in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Detective Todd Rosenstein.  Exhibits 1, 2, and 3 received. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhbits 1, 2, and 3 withdrawn. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Defense requested and arraignment date. State put on notice that the Defense will be addressing bail on the next court date. Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Arraignment scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Jonathan L Ward in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Jonathan L Ward in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Amended Complaint received and filed this date correcting offense date in charging portion of the complaint only.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
